member.summary: Represents a single work item in an Asset import or re-import operation.

member.summary: [GET] The path where this input file is located.

member.summary: [GET] The input's asset name. Use this to derive Resource names from input items during import operations.

member.summary: This is a shortcut method for interating over the available input and ask to handle each item that matches the specified predicate. If no predicate is specified, this method will try to handle all available input.
member.returns: Enumerates all input items which the requesting importer is allowed to handle.

member.name: M:Duality.Editor.AssetManagement.IAssetImporter.PrepareImport(Duality.Editor.AssetManagement.IAssetImportEnvironment)
member.summary: In the preparation step of an import operation, an importer determines which (if any) of the available files it is able to handle and registers the expected output Resources.

member.name: M:Duality.Editor.AssetManagement.IAssetImporter.Import(Duality.Editor.AssetManagement.IAssetImportEnvironment)
member.summary: Performs the previously prepared import operation. Creates and / or modifies Resources according to the available input files.

member.name: M:Duality.Editor.AssetManagement.IAssetImporter.PrepareExport(Duality.Editor.AssetManagement.IAssetExportEnvironment)
member.summary: In the preparation step of an export operation, an importer determines whether it is able to handle the specified Resource and registers the expected output source files.

member.name: M:Duality.Editor.AssetManagement.IAssetImporter.Export(Duality.Editor.AssetManagement.IAssetExportEnvironment)
member.summary: Performs the previously prepared export operation. Creates and / or modifies source files according to the specified input Resource.

member.summary: [GET] The user-friendly name of this importer.

member.name: M:Duality.Editor.ExtMethodsBitmap.Resize(System.Drawing.Bitmap,System.Int32,System.Int32,Duality.Alignment)
member.summary: Creates a resized version of a Bitmap. Gained space will be empty, lost space will crop the image.
member.param: The original Bitmap.
The desired width.
The desired height.
The desired resize origin in the original image.
member.returns: A new Bitmap that has the specified size.

member.summary: Creates a rescaled version of a Bitmap.

The desired width.
The desired height.

member.returns: A new Bitmap that has been scaled to the specified size.

member.summary: Scales the Bitmap to fit entirely within the specified boundaries, while keeping its original aspect ratio.

Whether the image should be cropped in Y-direction

member.summary: Marks the license as accepted. Only ever call this when the end user has seen and explicitly accepted the license terms.

member.name: F:Duality.Editor.PackageManagement.PackageManager.DualityPackageNames
member.summary: A list of package names that are considered "core" Duality packages. If none of these show up anywhere in the deep dependency graph of a Duality package, it will be assumed that dependencies are simply not specified properly.

member.name: M:Duality.Editor.PackageManagement.PackageManager.GetUpdatablePackages
member.summary: Enumerates all target packages for local installs that could be updated.

member.name: M:Duality.Editor.PackageManagement.PackageManager.GetCompatibilityLevel(Duality.Editor.PackageManagement.PackageInfo)
member.summary: Determines compatibility between the current package installs and the specified target package. Works for both updates and new installs.

member.name: M:Duality.Editor.PackageManagement.PackageManager.OrderByDependencies(System.Collections.Generic.IList{Duality.Editor.PackageManagement.PackageInfo})
member.summary: Sorts the specified list of packages according to their dependencies, guaranteeing that no package is listed before its dependencies. Use this to determine the order of batch updates and installs to prevent conflicts from having different versions of the same packages.

member.name: M:Duality.Editor.PackageManagement.PackageManager.GetDeepDependencies(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Duality.Editor.PackageManagement.PackageInfo})
member.summary: Enumerates the complete dependency tree of the specified packages.

member.name: M:Duality.Editor.PackageManagement.PackageManager.GetDeepDependencyCount(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Duality.Editor.PackageManagement.PackageInfo})
member.summary: Determines the number of deep dependencies for each package in the specified collection.
Determines the number of deep dependencies for the specified package.

member.summary: [GET] The local directory where packages are installed and stored prior to applying the update.

member.name: P:Duality.Editor.Properties.GeneralRes.LicenseAcceptDialog_FirstStartGeneric
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to This is the first time you are starting Duality. By using it, you are agreeing to its license terms, as linked below..

member.name: P:Duality.Editor.Properties.GeneralRes.LicenseAcceptDialog_PackageDesc
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Installing package {0} requires a license agreement..

member.name: P:Duality.Editor.Properties.GeneralRes.LicenseAcceptDialog_TranscriptUnavailable
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to License text transcript unavailable. Check the License Url link below for the original license text source..

member.name: P:Duality.Editor.Properties.GeneralRes.MenuItemInfo_ConfigureLauncher
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Select which launcher application should be used for external game tests. By default, the Duality Launcher is used..

member.name: P:Duality.Editor.Properties.GeneralRes.MenuItemInfo_DebugGame
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to If you're using a professional version of Visual Studio, this action will run the Duality launcher and trigger a debug event that allows you to attach the debugger to your game before anything happens. You can achieve the same by clicking the "Run" button of your Core Plugin in Visual Studio itself..

member.name: P:Duality.Editor.Properties.GeneralRes.MenuItemInfo_NewProject
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Duality always works locally in a project folder. The New Project dialog will help you set up a new one..

member.name: P:Duality.Editor.Properties.GeneralRes.MenuItemInfo_OpenProjectSource
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The project source code is where your game logic happens. To help you get started, Duality will create and open a suitable Visual Studio solution for you..

member.name: P:Duality.Editor.Properties.GeneralRes.MenuItemInfo_ProfileGame
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Runs the game in profiling mode without VSync or any other frame rate limiting mechanism..

member.name: P:Duality.Editor.Properties.GeneralRes.MenuItemInfo_PublishGame
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Creates a version of the game ready to distribute to others, with all necessary files.

member.name: P:Duality.Editor.Properties.GeneralRes.MenuItemInfo_RunGame
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Want to see how your game looks like in its release version? This will save all project data and run the external Duality launcher..

member.name: P:Duality.Editor.Properties.GeneralRes.MenuItemInfo_SandboxFaster
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Increases the Sandboxes game speed. This will not cause it to update more often, but simulate a higher timestep in each update..

member.name: P:Duality.Editor.Properties.GeneralRes.MenuItemInfo_SandboxPause
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Pausing the Sandbox will suspend any game updates. Until being unpaused, the Sandbox will behave as if it wasn't there..

member.name: P:Duality.Editor.Properties.GeneralRes.MenuItemInfo_SandboxPlay
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Unlike "Run Game", entering the Sandbox mode doesn't rely on the Duality Launcher and will instead run the game directly inside the editor. This allows you to test and debug your game in real time while at the same time providing full editing functionality. Note that you'll have to focus a Cam View in "Game View" mode in order to pass on keyboard and mouse input to the game..

member.name: P:Duality.Editor.Properties.GeneralRes.MenuItemInfo_SandboxSlower
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Decreases the Sandboxes game speed. This will not cause it to update less often, but simulate a lower timestep in each update..

member.name: P:Duality.Editor.Properties.GeneralRes.MenuItemInfo_SandboxStep
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to A Sandbox step will cause the game to advance exactly one standard frame..

member.name: P:Duality.Editor.Properties.GeneralRes.MenuItemInfo_SandboxStop
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to When leaving the Sandbox mode, the current Scene will be reset to its original state..

member.name: P:Duality.Editor.Properties.GeneralRes.MenuItemInfo_SaveAll
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to This will save all project data, i.e. all existing Resources. If you take a look at the Project View, you might notice that some Resources are written in italics - these are the ones that have been changed without being saved yet..

member.name: P:Duality.Editor.Properties.GeneralRes.MenuItemInfo_SerializerUpdateAll
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to This operation will load and re-save all existing Resources. Due to the serialization progress, all Resources will be guaranteed to use the same file format and to be up-to-date according to core plugin class definitions..

member.name: T:Duality.Editor.NativeMethods.FileOperationFlags
member.summary: Possible flags for the SHFileOperation method.

member.name: F:Duality.Editor.NativeMethods.FileOperationFlags.FOF_SILENT
member.summary: Do not show a dialog during the process

member.name: F:Duality.Editor.NativeMethods.FileOperationFlags.FOF_NOCONFIRMATION
member.summary: Do not ask the user to confirm selection

member.name: F:Duality.Editor.NativeMethods.FileOperationFlags.FOF_ALLOWUNDO
member.summary: Delete the file to the recycle bin. (Required flag to send a file to the bin

member.name: F:Duality.Editor.NativeMethods.FileOperationFlags.FOF_SIMPLEPROGRESS
member.summary: Do not show the names of the files or folders that are being recycled.

member.name: F:Duality.Editor.NativeMethods.FileOperationFlags.FOF_NOERRORUI
member.summary: Surpress errors, if any occur during the process.

member.name: F:Duality.Editor.NativeMethods.FileOperationFlags.FOF_WANTNUKEWARNING
member.summary: Warn if files are too big to fit in the recycle bin and will need to be deleted completely.

member.name: T:Duality.Editor.NativeMethods.FileOperationType
member.summary: File Operation Function Type for SHFileOperation

member.name: F:Duality.Editor.NativeMethods.FileOperationType.FO_MOVE
member.summary: Move the objects

member.name: F:Duality.Editor.NativeMethods.FileOperationType.FO_COPY
member.summary: Copy the objects

member.name: F:Duality.Editor.NativeMethods.FileOperationType.FO_DELETE
member.summary: Delete (or recycle) the objects

member.name: F:Duality.Editor.NativeMethods.FileOperationType.FO_RENAME
member.summary: Rename the object(s)

member.name: T:Duality.Editor.PathHelper
member.summary: Provides helper methods for handling Paths.

member.name: M:Duality.Editor.PathHelper.GetFreePath(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Returns a path that isn't taken yet.
member.param: The path to use as base for finding a available path.
The (file) extension to add to the new path.
member.returns: A path that doesn't relate to any existing file or directory.

member.name: M:Duality.Editor.PathHelper.MakeFilePathRelative(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Returns the relative path from one path to another.
member.param: The path to make relative.
The path to make it relative to.
member.returns: A path that, if combined with relativeTo, equals the original path.

member.name: M:Duality.Editor.PathHelper.GetMutualBaseDirectory(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String})
member.summary: Determines the mutual base directory of a set of paths.

member.name: M:Duality.Editor.PathHelper.IsPathVisible(System.String)
member.summary: Returns whether the specified file or directory is visible, i.e. not hidden.

member.name: M:Duality.Editor.PathHelper.IsPathValid(System.String)
member.summary: Returns whether the specified path is considered a valid file or folder path. Does not check whether the file or folder actually exists, only if the path can be validly used to address one.

member.name: M:Duality.Editor.PathHelper.CopyDirectory(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Predicate{System.String})
member.summary: Deep-Copies the source directory to the target path.

member.name: M:Duality.Editor.PathHelper.DeleteEmptyDirectory(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Checks whether the specified directory is empty and deletes it, if it is.
member.param: If true, each deleted directories parent directory will be evaluated as well.

member.name: M:Duality.Editor.PathHelper.FilesEqual(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Determines whether the contents of two files are completely equal.

member.name: P:Duality.Editor.PathHelper.ExecutingAssemblyDir
member.summary: Returns the directory

member.name: T:Duality.Editor.RecycleBin
member.summary: Send files directly to the recycle bin.

member.name: M:Duality.Editor.RecycleBin.Send(System.String,Duality.Editor.NativeMethods.FileOperationFlags)
member.summary: Send file to recycle bin
member.param: Location of directory or file to recycle
FileOperationFlags to add in addition to FOF_ALLOWUNDO

member.name: M:Duality.Editor.RecycleBin.Send(System.String)
member.summary: Send file to recycle bin. Display dialog, display warning if files are too big to fit (FOF_WANTNUKEWARNING)
member.param: Location of directory or file to recycle

member.name: M:Duality.Editor.RecycleBin.SendSilent(System.String)
member.summary: Send file silently to recycle bin. Surpress dialog, surpress errors, delete if too large.
member.param: Location of directory or file to recycle
